revision.text:
{{BLP sources|date=March 2017}} {{Infobox person | name = Andy Kindler | image = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1956|10|16}} | birth_place = [[Queens, New York|Queens]], [[New York (state)|New York]], U.S.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://gothamist.com/2006/11/22/andy_kindler_co.php |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2015-11-12 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150507073459/http://gothamist.com/2006/11/22/andy_kindler_co.php |archivedate=2015-05-07 |df= }}</ref> | residence = [[Los Angeles, California]], U.S. | occupation = Comedian. | years_active = 1987â€“present |spouse = Susan Maljan (m. 2003) }} '''Andy Kindler''' (born October 16, 1956) is an [[United States|American]] [[comedian]] from [[Queens, New York]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Comedy-Contact Biography Page |url=http://www.comedycontact.com/kindler.html |accessdate=2007-10-23 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070928075540/http://www.comedycontact.com/kindler.html |archivedate=2007-09-28 |deadurl=yes |df= }}</ref>
==Stand up== His material often covers the comedy industry itself, criticizing other comedians for being too predictable. At his annual state of the industry address at Montreal's "Just For Laughs" festival, he criticized [[Dane Cook]], [[Louis CK]], [[Chelsea Handler]] and [[Jay Leno]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Audio interview: Andy Kindler goes after Louis C.K., state of comedy and more (Exclusive)|url=http://www.laughspin.com/2012/07/30/audio-interview-andy-kindler-goes-after-louis-c-k-state-of-comedy-and-more-exclusive/|work=Laughspin|accessdate=April 25, 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130617095410/http://www.laughspin.com/2012/07/30/audio-interview-andy-kindler-goes-after-louis-c-k-state-of-comedy-and-more-exclusive/|archivedate=June 17, 2013|df=}}</ref>
==Acting== He played the character "Andy", a fellow sportswriter and friend of sportswriter "Ray Barone" ([[Ray Romano]]) on the TV show ''[[Everybody Loves Raymond]]'', was a regular guest on ''[[Late Show with David Letterman]]'', contributor to ''[[The Daily Show]]'' and has performed on [[HBO]]. He is also known for his annual "State of the Industry" address at the [[Just for Laughs]] comedy festival in Montreal. In 2010, Kindler was a judge on the stand-up reality show ''[[Last Comic Standing]]''. In 2010 he appeared on several episodes of ''[[Wizards of Waverly Place]]'' as Chancellor Tootietootie.
As a voice actor, Kindler has made numerous appearances on ''[[Dr. Katz, Professional Therapist|Dr. Katz]]'' and ''[[Home Movies (TV series)|Home Movies]]'' from producer [[Loren Bouchard]]. He regularly voices the character of Mort, a [[mortician]] and the Belchers' neighbor, on Bouchard's show ''[[Bob's Burgers]]''.
Kindler is often thought to have portrayed the character of "Jamison" in the [[WWE|World Wrestling Federation]], but the character was portrayed by a different actor by the name of John DiGiacomo.<ref>{{cite web|title=Kindler Talks About "Jamison"|url=http://andykindler.blogs.com/blah_blah_blog/2008/01/february-made-m.html}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://pojoslam.blogspot.com/2010/08/interview-with-jameson-part-1.html|title=Real Jameson Actor Revealed}}</ref>
He plays a fictionalized version of himself in the IFC series ''[[Maron (TV series)|Maron]]''.<ref>{{cite web|title=Maron|url=http://www.ifc.com/shows/maron/blog/2013/05/watch-judd-hirsch-and-marc-maron-in-a-new-clip-from-maron|work=IFC|accessdate=May 23, 2013}}</ref>
Andy will star as Barry Bitterman in the dark comedy feature film [[The Fiddling Horse]] from director [[CJ Wallis]] <ref>{{cite web|title=Andy Kindler to Star in Fiddling Horse|url=https://variety.com/2018/film/news/andy-kindler-fiddling-horse-1202755892/}}</ref>
==Other== In 1996, he offered $1 million to anyone who could produce a video showing where [[Whoopi Goldberg]] was funny.<ref>Getlen, Larry. The Comic Who Calls Louis C.K. 'Pretentious' and Jimmy Fallon a 'Phony'. New York Post, May 15, 2015 https://nypost.com/2015/05/16/the-comic-who-calls-louis-c-k-pretentious-and-jimmy-fallon-a-phony/ Accessed May 16, 2015</ref>
Kindler currently cohosts the weekly podcast ''Thought Spiral'' with friend and fellow comedian [[J. Elvis Weinstein]].
Kindler is [[Judaism|Jewish]].<ref>https://twitter.com/andykindler/status/883923944142626816</ref>
